text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so today 
I am standing in the backyard of my parents home

in Bangkok and I'm making something that I've 
been waiting all year to come home to make okay

I'm making something called miang kham which has 
requested a lot it's basically a bite-sized wrap

and it's got toasted coconut peanuts and lime 
and ginger it's so good but the reason why I had

to wait till I get here to make it is because I 
wanted to use something called betel leaves or bai

chaploo which is what we're going to use to wrap 
it and it grows like crazy in my parents backyard

so as you can see all this is bai chaploo and 
there are these leaves that are hard shape and

its got a nice earthy flavor and if you don't 
have this what you can do is you can use Chinese

broccoli or guideline so basically you want to 
substitute it with a dark green leave with a bit

of an earthy flavor okay you can find these I've 
seen them in some Thai grocery stores Vietnamese

grocery stores but they can be a little harder to 
find and so what I'm going to do is I'm going to

pick some of these so this one just really know 
is too small it's nice and tender because young

but I won't be able to wrap anything with it 
so something like this is perfect and just FYI

if you look over there can anyone identify what 
this is bonus points if you can alright so I'm

just going to pick a bunch of these give them 
a good wash and I'll meet you in the kitchen

so let's picked and wash my cup to leave now since 
this isn't make your own rap kind of thing all you

have to do really is lay out all the ingredients 
so I thought here okay some shallots isn't as you

can see Thai shallots are so tiny little they're 
like marbles I've also got some lime now this is a

pile I'm and the skin is a lot thinner and they're 
a lot smaller this does make a difference in this

recipe and I'll talk about it in the end when I 
when I cut everything so I've got some chili some

Thai chilies some ginger and I peeled the ginger 
now these two are the most important things I've

got roasted peanuts you're allergic to peanuts 
you can do cashews instead and roasted coconut

so this coconut might look a little darker than 
you normally toast your coconut you know in North

America they like light and golden we like it's 
dark dim intense so I am a little hardcore so I

got this coconut from a whole coconut I took it 
out of the shell I use the peeler to shave off

thin pieces and then cut them into sticks and then 
I just toast them in a dry wok until they're dark

and deep and you get a really nice toasty intense 
or most a little nutty and earthy aroma it really

does make a difference you can just start out 
with dry coconut just choose larger ones don't

go with the shredded one alright and one last 
thing is dried shrimp what I need to do because

we're going to eat them whole is soak them with 
hot water and allow them to soften a little bit

otherwise it will be kind of hard on your jaw 
so I've got hot water here and I'm just going

to let these sit in hot water for now 15 minutes 
however long you know do this first and then just

let them sit until you're ready and that is it so 
the one thing that you do have to cook really is

the sauce so we're going to get that started 
so the sauce is sort of a sweet savory sauce

fake luscious lots of ingredients in it that 
are pretty similar to what goes in the wraps

so first what I'm going to do is I've got some 
dry from here and I want to blitz these in the

blender and who they're nice and fine and I want 
to blitz uh separately because dry shrimp shred

really well when it's dry in the blender once 
I put water into it it doesn't blitz quite as

well and that's it look at that it's like shrimp 
snowglobe and then I'm going to add my herbs so

I've got here some galangal now you might look 
at this and think okay that is way too yellow

to be galangal that is how they are at my house 
so we grow them in our backyard and this is what

they look like when when we just dig it up so the 
galangal is actually a rhizome and these are the

roots so just roughly chopped there go long ago 
and now I've got some ginger this happens to be

younger ginger what I have now just a little water 
just enough to get it going I save a little bit to

rinse the blender after okay mmm smells really 
really spicy right now actually don't worry that

will cook down won't be very intense so now if you 
can get it a little finer than that please do this

blender is not the most powerful of blenders see 
when I'm home my mom doesn't cook very much so

it's not the most well-equipped kitchen so I make 
do with whatever she's got but you know it always

works and now I saved a little bit of water just 
to rinse out the blender so there's always stuff

[ __ ] in there okay to this I am going to add 
palm sugar so this looks like a lot of palm sugar

and it is because this is a primarily sweet and 
sticky sauce and also I'm going to add some fish

sauce and look at my new fish sauce bottle as I 
said my mom doesn't cook very much so she likes

to buy smaller fish sauce because fish sauce does 
not last forever believe it or not and also some

shrimp paste so this is fermented shrimp paste or 
what we call cup eight okay add a funk saltiness

and umami if you don't have it you can just add 
some more fish sauce if you want to leave it out

all together so in the beginning you can crank the 
heat and get the sugars dissolved quickly but once

it starts to boil in the sugars all dissolve 
you want to turn it down let it simmer slowly

for about five minutes so here is the sauce 
and I must go a little too long so it's too

thick now it's still hot and it's quite thick 
as you can see so once it's cool it'll be even

thicker so that happens no big deal you just add 
a little water mmm smells really funky fish does

and shrimp paste it'll smell better because now 
I'm going to add toasted coconut so this is the

same toasted coconut that I talked about earlier 
except I blitz it in a food processor so it's fine

and this is going to add flavor and also texture 
to the sauce so I'm going to add maybe just that

much first okay and now roasted peanuts which 
I also ground up a little bit there see where

we're at in terms of texture and then I'll add I 
can add a little more if I want oh now it smells

really good I'm telling you you wrote your coconut 
as dark advise you you'll experience a whole level

of aroma that you've never had before it's really 
good and you definitely want to let this cool to

room temperature before you eat it because melted 
sugar is extremely hot oh you know what and you to

taste this shrimp paste not all of them are the 
same and you've let it reduce or who knows what

it's like now so you want to taste for flavor mmm 
I'm going to add a little bit more fish sauce you

want it to be primarily sweet but a little bit 
of salt to help give it a little more you know

personality and I think we're golden and here is 
the complete Mian come step as you can see it's

very beautiful to serve I chopped up my shallots 
into little cubes okay you don't want it to be

too big because it's quite pungent we're eating 
this raw I've also cut my ginger to be a little

cubed so huge the dried shrimp I've drained and 
patted dry and so they're now they're not too

hard now the line as you can see I cut the line 
into sort of little cubes with the skin on and

you can only do this if you're using tie lines 
which have very thin skin so it's not true and

it's not bitter what we're going for here is some 
acidity Plus that lime zest or Rome others we all

love if you're dealing with big American lines 
what you want to do is grate the zest set it

aside and then cut off all the white bit and cut 
the flesh just the flesh into little cubes then

toss the flesh with the zest hey that rhymes toss 
the quest pop the flesh with the zest and then

you sort of get what we're trying to go for here 
and then of course chilies cut them really small

because you know it can be a little spicy so with 
my truffle leaf I like to snip off this little bit

here which can be tough some people just cut it 
off so what you do is make a little cone with your

two leaves by doing that okay just like that then 
you have a little cup now you start filling it so

I always like to fill with the coconut first and 
that's what of the main ingredient you want the

most coconut and then a few peanuts the chili is 
just you don't want to grab it with your fingers

for obvious reasons so I always like to have 
a little fork and put that in one is plenty I

think and a little lime a little shallow shelves 
you can add one or two is kind of up to you and

same as ginger you can add one or two and dried 
shrimp one or two my own like sad like sorry for

dried shrimp so with really once you start having 
these you'll figure out what ratio of different

ingredients you like best so now the sauce it's 
pretty intense so just maybe like a quarter

teaspoon just a nice dollop I like to use the tail 
to sit close it make a nice bite and here we go

it is a flavor unlike any other dish if you've 
had me income before you know that it is so unique

you've got this whole scene Asst from coconut and 
peanuts and balanced by the sharp hardness of the

lime and freshness from shallots and ginger deep 
from the chilies and the butyl leaves itself has

a bit of an earthiness to lid it's got a unique 
flavor as well and the sauce is sweet a little

rich wow this is so it's such an experience 
if you've never had it I really encourage

you to try it if you come to Thailand these are 
available at a lot of different sometimes noodle

markets will have it so even if you don't make 
it I think it's an experience you should try

so the recipe as always will be on oxygen calm 
when you make it send me a photo on Facebook

Twitter or Instagram if you haven't described in 
show please do so right here outputs buzz button

somewhere and I will see you next time for your
